page.title: 12EEL FISHING
page.content: {Mr Wraight}came to our classroom yesterday morning after playtime. Mr Wraight brought an {eel}in to our classroom. The colour of the eel was a greyish silver. These are some of the{ {amazing things}about eels. Eels{teeth} grow{backwards}so that they can keep hold of the things they are biting. Another amazing thing about eels is that they can{climb walls.}They can also{twist}their own{heads off!}They can{live out of water}till sunset,and last of all they can{go across fields. Eels will wriggle when they are half cooked! Nets are made with a certain number of rings with net over. Mr Wraight catches eels to sell to the market in{London.}Mr Wraight brought in a net the net was about 2\metres long. Eels can{eat almost anything. (By Rachel Leavesley aged 8 years)
